basics.name: Varun Patil
basics.label: Recent grad from Indiana University
basics.summary: I have recently graduated from Indiana University with my Masters in Computer Science and am looking out for jobs in Web Development and Software Engineering that align with my interests and skills set.

work.summary:
Worked  as a Technological Lead on the SOLACE project under the guidance of Dr. Kay Connelly.
				  \nMy responsibility was to enable the successful migration of the server. The including tasks were
				  \n Database Design
				  \n Debugging Windows Application Code
				  \n Testing Hardware Components
				  \n Installation and Deployment
				  \nTechnologies: C#, MySQL, Audrino

Worked on the Capital Value Systems project which automated the process of calculating property taxes in the Greater Mumbai area. The projects was being developed for the Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai. I worked on the project as a black-box tester.

project.name: Web Calculator
project.summary: Designed and developed a web calculator implementing addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, square root and clear screen functionality. \n Additionally, the calculator had a theme that enabled the user to switch between light and dark themes. \nTechnologies: HTML5, CSS3,JavaScript.

project.name: Property Rate Recommendation System
project.summary: Used Case-based Reasoning to predict the rents of the houses in a particular area. \n The predictions were made in accordance with six parameters: zip code, area of the house, per capita income of the household, type of the house, year of construction or redevelopment and the locality indicator.\n Euclidean distance was used to find the nearest clusters which were filtered using a Rule-Based approach.

project.name: Cloud Computing Projects using Hadoop, HDFS, HBase and Pig
project.summary:
1) Hadoop Blast:\n
					 Hadoop-Blast is an advanced Hadoop program which helps BLAST (Basic Local Alignment Search Tool), a bioinformatics application, to utilize the computing capability of Hadoop.\n
					 2) PageRank Algorithm:\n
					 Implemented a parallel version of PageRank using the programming interfaces of the Hadoop MapReduce framework.\n
					 3) Pig K-means\n
					 Implemented K-means clustering algorithm using Pig.\n
					 4) Search Engine:\n
					 Created inverted index and stored it in HBase. Ranked all the documents using Page Rank algorithm. Can search query, based on index created and return documents based on ranking.

project.name: Thanksgiving
project.summary:
A team of four members, built a task management system for roommates to create, assign, edit and track daily chores to be shared among roommates.
	  \nMy responsibilities included to Analyze, Design, Build and Test the application with strict adherence to Agile Methodology and Industry standard coding metrics.
	  \nThe application was designed and built using Java Servlets, Java Server Pages, Bootstrap (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), My SQL 6.2, Eclipse Luna IDE and Tomcat v7.0 server to host the application.

project.name: Logic Vulnerabilities in Web Applications
project.summary:
A research project that focused on the analysis of web vulnerabilities that are specific to the functionality of the application.
	  \nAnalyzed the common logic flaws in website development and demonstrated three attacks targeting them.
	  \nA comparative analysis of detection prototypes including Waler, MiMoSa, Swaddler, BLOCK and Inte-Guard.

project.name: Analysis of VirusTotal Android Application
project.summary:
Compiled the results after tests on 228 android applications on Google PlayStore.
	  \nResults showed many cases of false positives including some of the most downloaded applications like Yelp.
	  \nDiscovered the existence of malicious applications on PlayStore like Talking Tom Cat 2 Free, Subway Surfers Free Tips.

volunteer.summary: Drawing sketches and reading books to mentally challenged students.
